Exaggerate: The claim of doubling the size of the company may be seen as an exaggeration, as the growth in revenue was a little bit more than double.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it only focuses on the increase in revenue and does not provide information about other metrics such as market share or profitability.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that doubling the size of the company in terms of revenue is the only measure of success, disregarding other factors that contribute to the overall performance of a company.
Exist alternative explanation: The growth in revenue can be attributed to the major acquisition of Compaq, rather than solely to the leadership of Carly Fiorina.
